channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Concerns raised over crash involving Chinese activists
item.description: A car crash that killed two prominent members of the Chinese pro-democracy movement has sparked accusations of sabotage.

item.title: Christchurch mosque shooting gunman flew drone over Al Noor Mosque before attacks
item.description: The man responsible for the Christchurch mosque terror attacks flew a drone over Al Noor Mosque before the shooting in March last year.

item.title: Capture of rare giant squid near Whakaari/ White Island
item.description: Marine experts hope a rarely seen squid fished up near Whakaari/ White Island will provide new clues about the recently recognised species.

item.title: Whakatāne rate rise set for 3.9 percent
item.description: Community requests have pushed Whakatāne's rate rise from 3.5 to 3.9 percent - far too high for one councillor.

item.title: Auckland food manufacturer fined $10k for tainted beef mince
item.description: Adding sulphites to food, which can slow down meat spoilage, is banned due to the risks it poses to asthma sufferers.

item.title: Christchurch rates to increase by 3.8% on average
item.description: Christchurch rates will increase by 3.8 percent on average - a rise which is more than had initially been proposed.

item.title: Kōkako 'Hoppy', rescued from Hunua Ranges, dies
item.description: A hopping kōkako that was rescued from Auckland's Hunua Ranges has died.

item.title: Six youths charged in relation to Hamilton aggravated robberies
item.description: Police have charged six young people in relation to recent aggravated robberies in Hamilton.

item.title: Waikato greenhouse gas production highest in New Zealand
item.description: Waikato was the biggest producer of greenhouse gases in the country in 2018, new data from Statistics New Zealand shows.

item.title: Police confirm fresh investigation into Andrew Falloon texts
item.description: Police have launched an investigation into allegations National MP Andrew Falloon sent inappropriate sexual messages to young women.

item.title: No new cases of Covid-19 in managed isolation facilities, Ashley Bloomfield confirms
item.description: There are no new cases in the country today and the government says they have been partnering with mobile providers to access key health websites free of data charges.

item.title: Police admit officer's hair cutting assault on boy 'completely inappropriate'
item.description: Police acknowledge the assault was culturally disrespectful and completely inappropriate. The man, who remains a sworn police officer, was discharged without conviction.

item.title: Yarrow Stadium upgrade gets $20m in government infrastructure spend
item.description: A $20 million contribution to the earthquake strengthening and upgrade of Yarrow Stadium is the big-ticket item in a $48 million government infrastructure spend in Taranaki.

item.title: Colin Craig can take Whale Oil defamation case back to High Court
item.description: Former Conservative Party leader Colin Craig has won part of his appeal against Whale Oil blogger Cameron Slater over defamation.

item.title: Electric vehicle industry group member 'disappointed' after government disbands it
item.description: The Electric Vehicles Leadership Group was formed in 2016 and wasstacked with industry representatives and experts.

item.title: Te Anau farmer accused of destroying 800 hectares of native forest in two years
item.description: A Te Anau farmer accused of slashing and burning down 800 hectares of native forest in two years has been served with an interim court order to stop.

item.title: Wintry blast affects much of the South
item.description: Parts of the south have woken up to snow, rain and wind today as a short, sharp southwest change hits the region, causing closures.

item.title: New managed isolation system 'open to free market flow', may see delays for Kiwis overseas
item.description: On the cards is the requirement to book a spot in managed isolation when an airline ticket is purchased. Air Commodore Darryn Webb says that might lead to some delays.
